_header: First mine uncunning and my rudeness
Title(s): On the chaunse of the dyse
_description: On the chaunse of the dyse — fifty-nine stanzas rhyme royal

Bod638.First Lines:
Fyrst myn vnkunnyng & my RudenesseVnto you all that listen know
                    her chaunce…
Bod638.Last Lines:
…ffor hasard hath with maistry quytte me soMy while that I
                    ioyles now leue yn wo
Bod638.Note: Folio 195 torn; ff. 197, 201 mutilated; lacks lines 295-336
Bod638.Attributed Title:
The chaunce of the Dyse (f. 195); Explicit The Chaunce of the Dyse (f.
                        203v)
Bod638.Facsimiles:
Robinson,  Pamela. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Manuscript Bodley 638: A Facsimile.
         Norman, OK: Pilgrim, and Woodbridge: Boydell and Brewer, 1982.

BodFair16.First Lines:
FIrst myn vnkunnynge and my rudenesseVnto yow alle that lysten
                    knowe here chaunce…
BodFair16.Last Lines:
…For hasarde hath with maystry quytte me sooMy while that I
                    ioylesses now leue in woo
BodFair16.Note:
Balade (3 stanzas, f. 148) treated as separate work from Chaunces (56
                    stanzas, ff. 148-154).
BodFair16.Attributed Title:
Balade vpon the Chaunse of the Dyse (f. 148); Explicit Balade vpon the
                    chaunse of the dyse (f. 148); Chaunces of the Dyse (f. 148v),
                    Explicit the Chaunce of thee Dyse (f. 154)
BodFair16.Facsimiles:
Norton-Smith,  John. 
             “Introduction.” 
             Bodleian Library MS Fairfax 16.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
BodFair16.Editions:
Hammond,  Eleanor Prescott. 
             “The Chance of the Dice.” 
             Englische Studien
         59 (1925): 1-16: 5-16.
Cohen,  Helen Louise. 
             The Ballade.
         New York: Columbia UP, 1915: 285 (three stanzas only).
